text.p: The following are top stories from selected Singapore newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Singapore Senior Minister Lee Kuan Yew says strong, decisive government means strong economy.
- Singapore Prime Miniseter Goh Chok Tong says People's Action Party will field more than one minority candidate in each Group Representation Constituency if there is a need.
- Resale flat values in northeast region rise faster in third quarter with increase of average of 6.7 percent.
- Singapore-based investors are world's biggest buyers of Wall Street stocks in first half of year.
- Malaysian Finance Minister Anwar Ibrahim expects to announce a budget for smooth and sustained growth, with measures to tackle current account deficit and resource imbalance.
- Singapore losses from U.S. investments amount to U.S.$121 million from cumulative investments of U.S. $1.3 billion, mostly in manufacturing, wholesale trade and banking.
- Japanese Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto begins negotiations to form new coalition government.
- Maybank announces plans to open second branch in Papua New Guinea next month.
- All applicants for initial public offer of bakery and cafe chain Delifrance Asia will be allocated shares at Singapore 78 cents.
